content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												The trailer makes it look really cool with some Halo/Quake style fast paced crazyness and it uses the same engine as Crysis but it's actually a buggy, broken mess. Within the first 2 minutes i got stuck in a wall and i had to reload the last checkpoint. The enemies also have zero AI and their tactics consist of either standing still and shooting or charging at you like kamikaze soldiers.It's as if someone remade a low budget FPS game from the Playstation 2 in the Cry Engine.Not very good.Buy a sandwich instead.2/10.

number of helpful: 11 of 15 people (73%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
Literally worse than Hitler.Quite possibly the worst videogame I've ever played in my life and a mortal threat for epileptics.My friend bought it for me as a joke, thinking it could be a case of "so bad it's funny", but it's just too bad.The game supposedly has a multiplayer focus, but there are zero servers listed in the server list and I doubt the any of the multiplayer modes are even functional. I booted up a server to try it but it wouldn't let me start without a secound player. I don't know another person who owns this game luckily but at least I got a good glimpse of the nice textures that were flashing white and stretching into the sky all across the map.There are seven weapons, none of which feel satisfying or fun to use on any of the bullet-sponge enemy varieties (there are two; the big dudes who take about three times too many bullets or punches to kill and have awful hitboxes and then there are the armoured kind of those guys). Some weapons lack the functionality they are described as having (looking at you, "Radio Frier"). The single-player campaign ends in an unwaranted cliffhanger and has three maps in total, all of which are near-impossible to navigate because everything looks the same and it's like the developers went out of their way to make sure that the way you're supposed to go is placed in the LEAST intuitive place possible.The voice-acting is atrocious, the story is awful, the graphics are admittedly not terrible (aside from character models and character animations) but they're buggy instead. The framerate is horrible and inconsistent. The game crashes both regularly and irregularly.There are maybe four songs in total that repeat throughout the entire game (when it isn't being completely silent aside from that one enemy that fell through the floor and is now shooting you from outside of the map) and yet if you asked me to hum one of them, I couldn't. They figured out how to put the least possible effort into creating the songs while making sure they still qualified as music somehow. Many things in the game lack sound effects entirely and the existing sound effects will only play at random occasions. An enemy can walk up to you from behind and start beating/shooting you in your back and you will have no idea until your screen turns red because no sound is playing at all.Don't buy this game for any reason except maybe if you're a hardcore masochist, in which case you'd still have more fun wedging hot needles under your thumbnails.

												A butchered game idea, a butchered game engine, and a butchered purchase. The graphics in this game make Quake 2 look realistic. Animation and character movement are choppy and sloppy. Buying this game will make you feel miserable. Use your money to buy another game, or to donate to Wikipedia; the world would be a better place either way.

Product received for free
												Buggy and unfulfilling. Even the title screen has the word "beta" on it. I didn't buy the game, I was gifted it, specifically so that I could stream it as part of my "worst games on steam" series. There's a couple of half decent ideas in there, but it felt like a mod made by a 15 year old in the 90s.
